thread.title_full: With Manchester United star Zlatan Ibrahimovic out-of-contract this summer, we look at the biggest stars who your club could sign on a free

author: gstonehouse
title: With Manchester United star Zlatan Ibrahimovic out-of-contract this summer, we look at the biggest stars who your club could sign on a free
text:
EFL TAKE YOUR PICK With Manchester United star Zlatan Ibrahimovic out-of-contract this summer, we look at the biggest stars who your club could sign on a free 
Football Whispers takes a look at the biggest names available at the end of this season Feature By Ryan Baldi, Football Whispers 3rd March 2017, 5:56 pm Updated: 3rd March 2017, 7:17 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments WITH Zlatan Ibrahimovic rattling in goal after goal for Manchester United this season, more Premier League sides might be inclined to follow the Red Devils’ example of signing high quality stars whose contracts have expired. 
Football Whispers have picked out the biggest names who will be available on a free transfer this summer PA:Press Association Zlatan Ibrahimovic is one of the big names available for free this summer Zlatan Ibrahimovic 
Signed as a free agent last summer, Ibrahimovic only committed to one season with the Red Devils, although, if he so wishes, there is an option to extend his Old Trafford stay a further year. 
Keep up to date with ALL the FOOTBALL news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Manager Jose Mourinho is keen for the 35-year-old, who has scored a remarkable 26 goals in 38 games this term, to stick with him for at least one more campaign, but nothing has been decided as yet.The former Barcelona and AC Milan star has shown that he has still got what it takes to compete at the highest level and would have no shortage of offers if he walks away from United . Getty Images Ibrahimovic’s contract expires at the end of the season at Old Trafford EPA Fernando Torres’ spell at Atletico Madrid could be coming to an end Getty Images The former Liverpool striker is not first-choice for Diego Simeone’s side Fernando Torres 
At 32, ex- Liverpool striker Fernando Torres is no longer a guaranteed starter for Atletico Madrid, with summer signing Kevin Gameiro more regularly preferred to partner Antoine Griezmann in attack. 
The World Cup-winner will be out of contract in June and, although be best days are behind him and he lacks yard of pace compared to his Anfield pomp, Torres still very much knows where the net is, and could improve many sides’ firepower. 
Whether he remains in Spain or looks to seek regular football elsewhere, a player of Torres’ ability could be an interesting option for some of Europe’s top clubs. Getty Images Pepe on a free would be a bargain for any side in Europe Getty Images The 34-year-old’s time at Madrid could end this summer Pepe 
The Portuguese centre-back was outstanding in helping his country secure their first major honour last summer at the European Championships. 
A stalwart of the Real Madrid backline since moving to the Spanish capital from Porto in 2007, Pepe could be set to leave the 11-time champions of Europe when his contract expires at the end of the season. 
With his blend of experience and technical ability, the 34-year-old could offer a short-term fix for any top club looking to patch up a shaky defence. 
However, a move to the cash-rich Chinese Super League looks like being Pepe’s most likely option as things stand. Weekend Round-Up : Watch the best action from the Premier League Thiago Motta 
Brazil-born Italy international Thiago Motta looks set to end his five-year stint at Paris Saint-Germain at the end of the current campaign. 
The former Barcelona and Inter Milan midfielder is a two-time Champions League winner with title-winning league campaigns under his belt in three different countries. 
At 34, Motta is not as mobile as he once was, but he remains an excellent passer capable of orchestrating play from the base of midfield. Getty Images Former Chelsea star Salomon Kalou is another summer freebie Getty Images The Hertha Berlin ace has bagged 29 goals in 81 matches Salomon Kalou 
He never quite cracked the Chelsea first-team on a regular basis during his six years at Stamford Bridge, but Salomon Kalou has developed into one of the most effective forwards in the Bundesliga with Hertha Berlin. 
After two seasons in Ligue 1 with Lille, in which he scored an impressive 34 goals and registered 11 assists in 79 appearances, the Ivory Coast international moved to Germany’s capital. 
The 31-year-old has found the net 29 times in 81 games for Hertha, usually operating on the left side of their attack and cutting inside onto his stronger right foot. 
Still in his early 30s, Kalou has plenty of top level football left in the tank, and would be an astute signing for any club. Getty Images Keisuke Honda is almost certain to leave AC Milan at the end of the season Getty Images Honda has won 82 caps for Japan but has only played six times for Milan this year Keisuke Honda 
Talented Japanese attacking midfielder Keisuke Honda is almost certain to leave AC Milan this summer, with little prospect of the Rossoneri offering the 30-year-old a new contract at the San Siro. 
With 82 international caps to his name, not to mention 36 goals for Japan, the versatile former CSKA Moscow star has top level experience, and his ability to play on either flank or centrally as a No.10 could make him a valuable asset for many clubs. Getty Images 11 Vincenzo Montella does not appear to be a fan of the Japan star 
After featuring regularly for Milan in his first two season with the club, Honda has fallen down the pecking order under Vincenzo Montella this term, having appeared just six times in all competitions. 
However, if any Premier League club hopes to snap Honda up, they’ll have to get motoring as Major League Soccer’s Seattle Sounders are reportedly very close to securing his services. Some of the best Premier League goals of the month for February Taison 
Although not out of contract until December, one-time Chelsea target Taison could be a solid pick-up for a lot of teams. 
The Brazilian playmaker has been at Shakhtar Donetsk since 2013 and has won two Ukrainian titles. 
The diminutive two-cap Selecao international is capable of playing centrally or on either wing with the creativity and an eye for goal that could see him succeed in one of Europe’s major leagues. 
He may not quite have the calibre to come straight into the starting XI of any of the Continent’s biggest sides, but Taison could be a useful squad option for a high-ranking team, or an ambitious signing for a club looking to rise up the table.
